questions.question_text: The continuing airworthiness of an aircraft, according to ICAO Annex 8, shall be determined by:
According to ICAO Annex 8, a certificate of airworthiness shall be renewed or shall remain valid subject to the:
options: Laws of the state of registry and operation
Laws of the state of registry

questions.question_text: The technical standards dealing with certification of aeroplanes are at present limited to multi engine aircraft of:
options: Up to 5700Kg maximum certificated take-off and landing mass
Up to 5700Kg maximum certificated take-off mass

questions.question_text: When an aircraft has sustained damage, the aircraft shall be allowed to resume its flight, if
options: The state of registry, the state of design and the state of manufacture consider that the aircraft is still airworthy
The state of manufacture informs the state of registry that the damage sustained is of a nature such that the aircraft is still airworthy
The state of registry considers that the damage sustained is of a nature such that the aircraft is still airworthy
